00026 template <class Key, class T>
00031 class hashtablemap
00032 {
00033   typedef hashtablemap<Key, T>     Self;

00035 public:
00036   typedef Key                key_type;
00037   typedef T                  data_type;
00038   typedef pair<const Key, T> value_type;
00039   typedef unsigned int       size_type;
00040   typedef int                difference_type;

00049   struct Node {
00050   public:
00051     Node(value_type val) : value_m(val) {}
00052     value_type value_m;
00053   };
00054 
00055   typedef bstmap<Key, Node*> bucket_type;
00056 
00057   // Hash Table array of bstmaps.
00058   bucket_type* table_m;
00059 
00060   // holds the number of values/elements in map
00061   // note: size_m =/= TABLE_SIZE.
00062   size_type size_m;
00063 
00064   // strings hash well with constants 31, 33, 37, 39, 41 well with less than 7 collisions.
00065   //  41 arbitrarily chosen because it's the largest of the list, prime, and 42 - 1
00066   size_type static const TABLE_SIZE = 41;

00074   template<typename _T>
00075   class _iterator 
00076   {
00077     typedef input_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00078     typedef _T value_type;
00079     typedef int difference_type;
00080     typedef value_type* pointer;
00081     typedef value_type& reference;
00082 
00083     friend class hashtablemap;
00084   private:
00085     // pointer to a table instance.    
00086     const hashtablemap* table_m;
00087     
00088     // pointer to a value_type.
00089     Node* node_m;
00090 
00091   public:
00092     _iterator(const hashtablemap* my_table = NULL, Node* my_node = NULL)
00093       : table_m(my_table), node_m(my_node) {}
00094 
00095     _iterator(const _iterator& x) 
00096       : table_m(x.table_m), node_m(x.node_m){}
00097 
00098     _iterator& operator=(const _iterator& x) {
00099       node_m = x.node_m;
00100       table_m = x.table_m;
00101       return *this;
00102     }
00103 
00104     reference operator*() 
00105     {
00106       try {
00107         if (node_m == NULL) {
00108           // throw runtime_error("Cannot access Node; Node is null");
00109           cerr << "ERROR: Cannot access Node; Node is NULL" << endl;
00110         }
00111         
00112         return node_m->value_m;
00113       } catch (runtime_error& e) {
00114         throw;
00115       }
00116     }
00117 
00118     pointer operator->() const
00119     {
00120       try {
00121         if (node_m == NULL) {
00122           // throw runtime_error("Cannot access Node; Node is null");
00123           cerr << "ERROR: Cannot access Node; Node is NULL" << endl;
00124         }
00125 
00126         return &(node_m->value_m);
00127       } catch (runtime_error& e) {
00128         throw;
00129       }
00130     }
00131 
00132     // Sets the node to the next successor node.
00133     _iterator& operator++() 
00134     {
00135       node_m = table_m->_successor_node(node_m);
00136       return (*this);
00137     }
00138 
00139     _iterator& operator++(int) 
00140     {
00141       iterator temp = *this;
00142       ++(*this);
00143       return temp;
00144     }
00145 
00146     // Static operator== for const to const iterator and variants.
00147     //  friend equality comparision operators to allow for "static"
00148     friend bool operator==(const _iterator& x, const _iterator& y) 
00149     {
00150       return (x.node_m == y.node_m);
00151     }
00152 
00153     friend bool operator!=(const _iterator& x, const _iterator& y)
00154     {
00155       return (x.node_m != y.node_m);
00156     }

00167   hashtablemap() 
00168     : table_m(new bucket_type[TABLE_SIZE]), size_m(0) {}
00169 
00171   hashtablemap(const Self& x)
00172     : table_m(new bucket_type[TABLE_SIZE]), size_m(0)
00173   {
00174     // Manual reinsert into a new table.
00175     for (const_iterator i = x.begin(); i != x.end(); ++i) {
00176       insert(*i);
00177     }
00178   }
00179 
00183   ~hashtablemap()
00184   {
00185     delete [] table_m;
00186   }

00189   Self& operator=(const Self& x) {
00191     if (this == &x) {
00192       return *this;
00193     }
00194 
00195     // Make anew before inserting.
00196     clear();
00197     
00198     for (const_iterator i = x.begin(); i != x.end(); ++i) {
00199       insert(*i);      
00200     }
00201   }
00202 
00206   iterator begin() {
00207     if (empty()) {
00208       return end();
00209     }
00210 
00211     // Finds the first node in the first non-empty bucket
00212     const bucket_type* first_filled_bucket = _find_next_nonempty_bucket();
00213 
00214     // First filled bucket cannot be NULL, else the whole table should be empty() == true.
00215     // Node* bstmap::begin()
00216     Node* first_node = first_filled_bucket->begin()->second;
00217     
00218     return iterator(this, first_node);
00219   }
00220 
00224   const_iterator begin() const {
00225     if (empty()) {
00226       return end();
00227     }
00228 
00229     // Finds the first node in the first non-empty bucket
00230     const bucket_type* first_filled_bucket = _find_next_nonempty_bucket();
00231 
00232     // First filled bucket cannot be NULL, else the whole table should be empty() == true.
00233     // bstmap->begin()
00234     Node* first_node = first_filled_bucket->begin()->second;
00235     
00236     return const_iterator(this, first_node);
00237   }

00244     // + 1 past the end.
00245     return iterator(this, NULL);

00253     // + 1 past the end.
00254     return const_iterator(this, NULL);

00260   bool empty() const 
00261   {
00262     return (size_m == 0);
00263   }

00268   size_type size() const 
00269   {
00270     return size_m;

00276   pair<iterator,bool> insert(const value_type& x) 
00277   {
00278     iterator it = find(x.first);
00279 
00280     // element exists already
00281     //  find() returns end() if element does not exist.
00282     if (it != end()) {
00283       return pair<iterator, bool>(iterator(this, it.node_m), false);
00284     } else {
00285       // insert new node
00286       int hashvalue = _hash(x.first);
00287       Node* new_node = new Node(x);
00288       
00289       const pair<Key, Node*> keynodepair(x.first, new_node);
00290       table_m[hashvalue].insert(keynodepair);
00291 
00292       ++size_m;
00293 
00294       return pair<iterator, bool>(iterator(this, it.node_m), true);
00295     }
00296   }
00297 
00301   void erase(iterator pos) {
00302     if (pos == NULL) {
00303       throw runtime_error("Cannot erase Null iterator");
00304     }
00305 
00306     erase(pos->first);
00307   }
00308 
00313   size_type erase(const Key& x) {
00314     iterator it = find(x);
00315     
00316     if (it == end()) {
00317       return 0;
00318     }
00319     
00320     int hashvalue = _hash(x);
00321 
00322     table_m[hashvalue].erase(x);
00323     --size_m;
00324     
00325     return 1; // since Key in maps are unique, can only be 1
00326   }
00327   
00331   void clear() {
00332     if (empty()) {
00333       return;
00334     }
00335 
00336     delete [] table_m;
00337     table_m = new bucket_type[TABLE_SIZE];
00338     size_m = 0;
00339   }
00340 
00346   iterator find(const Key& x) {
00347     int hashvalue = _hash(x);
00348     
00349     bucket_type* ptr = table_m + hashvalue;
00350     typename bucket_type::iterator it = ptr->find(x);
00351 
00352     if (it == ptr->end()) {
00353       return end();
00354     }
00355 
00356     return iterator(this, (*it).second);
00357   }
00358 
00364   const_iterator find(const Key& x) const {
00365     int hashvalue = _hash(x);
00366     
00367     bucket_type* ptr = table_m + hashvalue;
00368     typename bucket_type::iterator it = ptr->find(x);
00369 
00370     if (it == ptr->end()) {
00371       return end();
00372     }
00373 
00374     return const_iterator(this, (*it).second);
00375   }
00376 
00380   size_type count(const Key& x) const 
00381   {
00382     // if found, then there must only be one instance as hashtable/bstmap only have unique entries.
00383     if (find(x) != end()) {
00384       return 1;
00385     } else {
00386       return 0;
00387     }
00388   }
00389   
00393   T& operator[](const Key& k) 
00394   {
00395     iterator it = find(k);
00396 
00397     if (it != end()) {
00398       // found key
00399       return (*it).second;
00400     } else {
00401       // not found -> create empty
00402       insert(value_type(k, T()));
00403       return (*this)[k];
00404     }
00405   }
00406 
00411   T& at(const Key& k) 
00412   {
00413     iterator it = find(k);
00414 
00415     if (it != end()) {
00416       // found key
00417       return (*it).second;
00418     } else {
00419       // not found -> throw out_of_range
00420       throw out_of_range("K is not found");
00421     }
00422   }
00423 
00424 private:
00425   
00431   int _hash(const Key& k) const
00432   {
00433     stringstream ss;
00434     ss << k;
00435     const char* c_str = ss.str().c_str();
00436     int hashvalue = 5381;
00437     double temp;
00438     for(double i = 1; *c_str != '\0'; ++c_str, ++i) {
00439       temp  = (*c_str)*pow(128.0, (double) i);
00440       hashvalue += (int) floor(temp);
00441     }
00442     
00443     hashvalue %= TABLE_SIZE;
00444 
00445     // returns a value between 0 and TABLE_SIZE (41)
00446     return hashvalue;
00447   }
00448 
00453   const bucket_type* _find_next_nonempty_bucket(int const index = -1) const {
00454     for (int i = index + 1; i < TABLE_SIZE; ++i) {
00455       if (!table_m[i].empty()) {
00456         return &table_m[i];
00457       }
00458     }
00459 
00460     return NULL;
00461   }
00462 
00467   Node* _successor_node(Node* n) const {    
00468     Key k = n->value_m.first;
00469     int hashvalue = _hash(k);
00470 
00471     bucket_type* curr_bucket = table_m + hashvalue;
00472     typename bucket_type::iterator next = ++(curr_bucket->find(k));
00473 
00474     // is there an element in current bucket?
00475     if (next != curr_bucket->end()) {
00476       return next->second;
00477     }
00478 
00479     const bucket_type* next_bucket = _find_next_nonempty_bucket(hashvalue);
00480       
00481     if (!next_bucket) {
00482       return NULL;
00483     }
00484 
00485     // return first node of next non-empty bucket
00486     return next_bucket->begin()->second;
00487   }
00488 };
